meanings.definition: The quality or state of being visible between two or more points or objects.
meanings.sent1: The intervisibility of the two lighthouses allowed ships to navigate safely.
meanings.sent2: The intervisibility of the mountain peaks was breathtaking from the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The intervisibility of the hide-and-seek players made the game more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The intervisibility of the stars in the night sky created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The intervisibility of the road signs helped drivers find their way in the dense fog.

meanings.definition: The ability to see or be seen between two or more points or objects.
meanings.sent1: The intervisibility of the mirrors in the room made it feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: The intervisibility of the characters on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The intervisibility of the students in the classroom made the teacher's job easier.
meanings.sent4: The intervisibility of the colors in the painting created a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: The intervisibility of the landmarks helped hikers navigate through the dense forest.
